title: Exit-All Doesn't Work As Expected
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Description I tried exiting all of my Pyrmont Validators and instead it exited one of the 6 times. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction prysm.bat validator accounts voluntary-exit --accept-terms-of-use --pyrmont --wallet-dir "C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\wallet" --wallet-password-file "C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\wallet\password.txt" --exit-all ## üî• Error 



C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm
Œª prysm.bat validator accounts voluntary-exit --accept-terms-of-use --pyrmont --wallet-dir "C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\wallet" --wallet-password-file "C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\wallet\password.txt" --exit-all
A subdirectory or file C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\dist already exists.
Latest prysm release is v1.3.8-hotfix+6c0942.
Using prysm version v1.3.8-hotfix+6c0942.
Validator is up to date.
WARN GPG verification is not natively available on Windows.
WARN Skipping integrity verification of downloaded binary
Verifying binary authenticity with SHA256 Hash.
SHA256 Hash Match
Starting Prysm validator accounts voluntary-exit --accept-terms-of-use --pyrmont --wallet-dir "C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\wallet" --wallet-password-file "C:\EthereumTestnet\prysm\wallet\password.txt" --exit-all
[2021-05-10 20:52:18]  WARN flags: Running on Pyrmont Testnet
About to perform a voluntary exit of 6 accounts
===============IMPORTANT===============
Withdrawing funds is not possible in Phase 0 of the system. Please navigate to the following website and make sure you understand the current implications of a voluntary exit before making the final decision:
https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/wallet/exiting-a-validator/#withdrawal-delay-warning
If you still want to continue with the voluntary exit, please input a phrase found at the end of the page from the above URL:
Exit my validator
[2021-05-10 20:52:50]  WARN validator: You are using an insecure gRPC connection. If you are running your beacon node and validator on the same machines, you can ignore this message. If you want to know how to enable secure connections, see: https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/secure-grpc
[2021-05-10 20:52:50]  INFO accounts: Voluntary exit was successful for the accounts listed. URLs where you can track each validator's exit:
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812

[2021-05-10 20:58:03]  WARN accounts: Could not perform voluntary exit for account 0x8de7ece1158f: failed to propose voluntary exit: rpc error: code = InvalidArgument desc = validator with index 110677 has already submitted an exit, which will take place at epoch: 39060
[2021-05-10 20:58:03]  WARN accounts: Could not perform voluntary exit for account 0xa1a301946bf7: failed to propose voluntary exit: rpc error: code = InvalidArgument desc = validator with index 110677 has already submitted an exit, which will take place at epoch: 39060
[2021-05-10 20:58:03]  WARN accounts: Could not perform voluntary exit for account 0xa6370a491d27: failed to propose voluntary exit: rpc error: code = InvalidArgument desc = validator with index 110677 has already submitted an exit, which will take place at epoch: 39060
[2021-05-10 20:58:03]  WARN accounts: Could not perform voluntary exit for account 0xa8bb5d0f59df: failed to propose voluntary exit: rpc error: code = InvalidArgument desc = validator with index 110677 has already submitted an exit, which will take place at epoch: 39060
[2021-05-10 20:58:03]  WARN accounts: Could not perform voluntary exit for account 0xb1d43f84ab37: failed to propose voluntary exit: rpc error: code = InvalidArgument desc = validator with index 110677 has already submitted an exit, which will take place at epoch: 39060
[2021-05-10 20:58:03]  INFO accounts: No successful voluntary exits
Press any key to continue . . .
## üåç Your Environment **Operating System:** 
  
Windows 10
**What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)** 
  
v1.3.8-hotfix+6c0942.
**Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?** publicKeys=0x8397a31277b4, 0x8de7ece1158f, 0xa1a301946bf7, 0xa6370a491d27, 0xa8bb5d0f59df, 0xb1d43f84ab37 https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/dashboard?validators=101958,108420,108433,110676,110677,110817

Unless I am missing something, I am not sure if I see the issue. Your first command managed to exit all your validators successfully, but the second time you ran it, it failed as all the validators have already been exited.

I think the functionality works fine, but it's this log which is incorrect:
```
[2021-05-10 20:52:50]  INFO accounts: Voluntary exit was successful for the accounts listed. URLs where you can track each validator's exit:
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812
https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812
```
This is probably an issue with a for-loop variable.

It attempted to exit the same validator 6 times instead of 6 different ones. 

It‚Äôs not just logging. I had to re-run in interactive mode to exit the other validators. Sorry I didn‚Äôt grab those logs. 

> On May 11, 2021, at 4:00 AM, Rados≈Çaw Kapka ***@***.***> wrote:
> 
> Ôªø
> I think the functionality works fine, but it's this log which is incorrect:
> 
> [2021-05-10 20:52:50]  INFO accounts: Voluntary exit was successful for the accounts listed. URLs where you can track each validator's exit:
> https://pyrmont.beaconcha.in/validator/b1d43f84ab379bb7772957d310bbb3b4f197a2745f8617efb853caf1c4ffe20ed10f3b691a48e71e4da822c36be83812

> 
> ‚Äî
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

Thanks for clarifying @davidkassa

I will look at it this week.

Hi @davidkassa , I looked into the matter and I cannot reproduce the issue. Can you please try again with a different set of validators and a new wallet, and check if you encounter the same issue? Thanks a lot!

Sure. I‚Äôll give it a try over the weekend.
